subject: Sleep
title: The 90-Minute Sleep Cycle
description: A micro-lesson that makes The 90-Minute Sleep Cycle usable.

hook.text: Set an alarm for a multiple of 90 minutes after falling asleep. You'll likely wake up feeling more refreshed.

buildup.text: Each sleep cycle lasts roughly 90 minutes and contains a sequence of N1, N2, N3, N2, then REM.

discovery.text: A typical night contains four to six complete cycles, totaling about six to nine hours.

twist.text: Waking mid-cycle, especially during deep sleep, causes grogginess. The brain resists being pulled out early.

climax.text: Smart alarms try to detect when you're in light sleep near a cycle boundary to wake you gently.

punchline.text: Sleep in 90-minute blocks for a smoother wake-up.

quiz.question: How long does one typical sleep cycle last?
